resolution_description: "Scallops" could revolutionize sustainable harvesting in the Gulf of Saint-Brieuc by implementing an innovative underwater farming system that uses biodegradable drones to monitor and selectively harvest mature scallops, ensuring population balance and ecological harmony without human intrusion.

required_participants.reasoning: The researchers are crucial for developing and implementing the innovative underwater farming system, as they possess the necessary expertise in marine biology, ecological balance, and sustainable practices.

The population of sea scallops is essential to the resolution as they are the primary species being monitored and harvested. Ensuring their health and sustainability is key to the success of the proposed system.

Fishermen are important stakeholders in the Gulf of Saint-Brieuc who will be affected by the new harvesting system. Their involvement will help facilitate the acceptance and practical implementation of the resolution in the local community.

Colleagues-scientists can provide additional insights, validation, and support for the research and technology behind the biodegradable drones, enhancing the credibility and effectiveness of the proposed solution.

resolution_description: As 'Translation', I propose a groundbreaking resolution to the sustainable harvesting of the diminishing scallop population in the Gulf of Saint-Brieuc by facilitating a multilingual, cross-disciplinary collaboration platform that leverages AI-driven real-time translation to unite global experts from marine biology, environmental science, and technology to co-create innovative, culturally sensitive solutions that are adaptable to local needs and ecological contexts.
